jewishConnections.description: Peter was a devout Jew whose faith in Jesus as Messiah fulfilled rather than abandoned his Jewish heritage. His story intersects deeply with Jewish tradition.

connections.name: Moses
connections.relationship: Peter witnessed Moses at the Transfiguration; both received divine revelation on mountains; both led God's people through periods of transition

connections.name: Abraham
connections.relationship: Peter's opening of the Gospel to Gentiles (Acts 10) fulfilled God's promise to Abraham that all nations would be blessed through his seed

connections.name: Jewish Messianic Expectation
connections.relationship: Peter's confession 'Thou art the Christ' reflects Jewish messianic hope; he initially expected a political deliverer

connections.name: Jerusalem Temple
connections.relationship: Peter continued worshipping at the Temple (Acts 3); healed the lame man at the Beautiful Gate during the ninth hour of prayer

connections.name: Jewish Dietary Laws
connections.relationship: Peter's vision of clean and unclean animals (Acts 10) challenged kosher distinctions, symbolizing Gentile inclusion

connections.name: Galilean Fishing Traditions
connections.relationship: Peter was a professional fisherman following Jewish purity laws about clean fish; Jesus called him to be a 'fisher of men'

connections.name: Transfiguration
connections.relationship: Peter witnessed Jesus speaking with Moses and Elijah, representing the Law and Prophets, showing continuity between Jewish tradition and Christian fulfillment

thematicConnections.description: Peter received the Keys of the Kingdom, analogous to Moses receiving the Law and the steward receiving the key of David (Isaiah 22:22)
Peter's denial and restoration parallels Moses's sin at Meribah yet continued service, and Paul's persecution of Christians followed by apostleship
Peter as the 'rock' connects to the rock at Horeb, the rock of the Temple Mount, and Christ the cornerstone
Peter walking on water echoes Israel crossing the Red Sea and Jordan - faith enabling passage through impossible circumstances
Peter's baptism of Cornelius and the Antioch church's mission fulfilled Abraham's promise of blessing to all nations

corpusSearchConnections.description: All references to Peter in biblical corpus
Aramaic name for Peter used by Paul

crossMythologyParallels.connection: Both suffered for bringing something essential to humanity (fire/Gospel); both endured painful deaths (chained and eaten/crucified upside-down)
Both serve as guardians at thresholds - Heimdall at Bifrost, Peter at the gates of heaven with the keys
